Najstnica z lastnim izumom osmešila celotno avtomobilsko industrijo

06 Nov 2019, 07:43

Alaina Gassler, 14-letnica iz mesta West Grove v ameriški zvezni državi Pensilvanija, je nedavno prejela nagrado v višini preračunanih 22.500 evrov od lokalnega inštituta, ki se ukvarja z matematiko, uporabno znanostjo, tehnologijo in inženiring. Genialno dekle je namreč zmagalo v tekmovanju s projektom, ki so ga poimenovali "izboljšanje varnosti avtomobilov z odstranjevanjem slepih točk". Izum najstnice dejansko odpravlja slepe točke v avtomobilu, to pa posledično pripomore k precej večji prometni varnosti.
Inovativni sistem 14-letnice temelji na osnovi miniaturnega projektorja in spletne kamere, ki je postavljena na okno sovoznika. Spletna kamera poskrbi, da se manjkajoči del vidnega polja zaradi stranskega "droga" prikazuje vozniku na zaslonu v realnem času. Za izris slike na podporni drog pa skrbi miniaturni projektor, ki je postavljen nad voznikovo glavo. Pri tem so porabili poseben material, ki odbija svetlobo projektorja na način, da je projicirana slika vidna samo vozniku in ne moti potnikov oziroma drugih udeležencev prometa, kot na primer pešcev.
Kako genialni izuma najstnice deluje v praksi, pa si lahko ogledate na spletni povezavi https://youtu.be/HxlNkIwqGb4.

A teenager with her own invention made the entire automotive industry smile

06 Nov 2019, 07:43

Alaina Gassler, a 14-year-old from West Grove, PA, recently received a $ 22,500 prize from a local math, applied science, technology, and engineering institute. A genius girl won a competition with a project they called "improving car safety by removing blind spots". The invention of the teenager actually eliminates the blind spots in the car, which in turn contributes to much greater road safety.
The 14-year-old's innovative system is based on a miniature projector and a webcam mounted on the front passenger window. The webcam ensures that the missing part of the field of view due to the side "pole" is shown to the driver on the screen in real time. To draw a picture on a support pole, however, is a miniature projector mounted over the driver's head. In doing so, they used special material that reflects the projector light in such a way that the projected image is visible only to the driver and does not disturb passengers or other road users, such as pedestrians.
How the ingenious invention of the teenager works in practice can be viewed at https://youtu.be/HxlNkIwqGb4.
